snippet: The deaths were the fourth mass killing of civilians since the military took control on July 3, but the first time those killed were in government custody at the time.
abstract: Egyptian government acknowledges that its security forces killed 36 Islamists in its custody, as the country's military leaders and Islamists vow to keep up their fight over the country's future; deaths, which military claims occurred during an attempted escape, are fourth mass killing of civilians since the military took control on July 3, but first time so many died while in government custody.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh, Kareem Fahim and David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The deaths were the fourth mass killing of civilians since the military took control on July 3, but the first time those killed were in government custody at the time.

headline.main: Islamists Killed While in Custody, Egypt Confirms
headline.print_headline: Islamists Killed While in Custody, Egypt Confirms

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
